lab4

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab4.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This program is based of TA Edwin's Sample Code Although not entirely the same, I have asked before hand to use his code, he had agree with it. This is the Controller class part of MVC, used to connect my view class and model class This class also has listeners connected to GUI components Instructor : Leonard Manzara
    Author:
    Ali Akbari

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller(lab4.View MortgageView, lab4.Mortgage MortgageModel)
      Constructor for my Controller, takes my View and my Model so that I can link the two with the Controller.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(lab4.View MortgageView,
                  lab4.Mortgage MortgageModel)
        Constructor for my Controller, takes my View and my Model so that I can link the two with the Controller. With my View, I get/set values from my elements, such as labels, text fields, combo boxes, radio buttons, etc. I also attach the listeners to my UI elements. With my Model, I use get/set methods to manipulate my object (Mortgage). If there are Mortgage-specific methods, these can be added in the Mortgage, otherwise the logic part of my program should be in here, the Controller.
        Parameters:
        MortgageView -
        MortgageModel -
